alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 1:37PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the last hour with the slow moving thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the next couple of hours from these slow moving thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, Cutler Bay, Zoo Miami, Palmetto Bay, Goulds, Richmond West, Princeton, The Crossings, Country Walk, Palmetto Estates, South Miami Heights, Howard, The Falls and Three Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
